metadata.title: CVE-2017-18120 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: A double-free bug in the read_gif function in gifread.c in gifsicle 1.90 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service attack or unspecified other impact via a maliciously crafted file, because last_name is mishandled, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-1000421. It was discovered that Gifsicle did not properly handle certain input. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious GIF, an attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code.

criterions.comment: gifsicle package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.91-2').
